verses.verse: I am a rose <S%H2261><s%> of Sharon, <S%H8289><s%> a lily <S%H7799><s%> of the valleys. <S%H6010><s%> Lover
As a lily <S%H7799><s%> among thorns, <S%H2336><s%> so is my love <S%H7474><s%> among the daughters. <S%H1323><s%> Beloved

As the apple tree <S%H8598><s%> among the trees <S%H6086><s%> of the wood, <S%H3293><s%> so is my beloved <S%H1730><s%> among the sons. <S%H1121><s%> I sat <S%H3427><s%> down under his shadow <S%H6738><s%> with great delight, <S%H2530><s%> his fruit <S%H6529><s%> was sweet <S%H4966><s%> to my taste. <S%H2441><s%>
He brought <S%H935><s%> me to the banquet <S%H3196><s%> hall. <S%H1004><s%> His banner <S%H1714><s%> over me is love. <S%H160><s%>
Strengthen <S%H7502><s%> me with raisins, <S%H809><s%> refresh <S%H7502><s%> me with apples; <S%H8598><s%> For I am faint <S%H2470><s%> with love. <S%H160><s%>
His left hand <S%H8040><s%> is under my head. <S%H7218><s%> His right hand <S%H3225><s%> embraces me. <S%H2263><s%>

I adjure <S%H7650><s%> you, <S%H1323><s%> daughters of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> by the roes, <S%H6643><s%> or <S%H176><s%> by the hinds <S%H355><s%> of the field, <S%H7704><s%> that you not stir up, <S%H5782><s%> nor awaken <S%H5782><s%> love, <S%H160><s%> until it so desires. <S%H2654><s%>
The voice <S%H6963><s%> of my beloved! <S%H1730><s%> Behold, <S%H935><s%> he comes, leaping <S%H1801><s%> on the mountains, <S%H2022><s%> skipping <S%H7092><s%> on the hills. <S%H1389><s%>

My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is like <S%H1819><s%> a roe <S%H6643><s%> or a young <S%H6082><s%> hart. <S%H354><s%> Behold, <S%H5975><s%> he stands behind <S%H310><s%> our wall! <S%H3796><s%> He looks <S%H7688><s%> in at the windows. <S%H2474><s%> He glances <S%H6692><s%> through the lattice. <S%H2762><s%>
My beloved <S%H1730><s%> spoke, <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to me, <S%H6965><s%> "Rise up, my love, <S%H7474><s%> my beautiful one, <S%H3303><s%> and come away. <S%H3212><s%>
For, <S%H5638><s%> behold, the winter is past. <S%H5674><s%> The rain <S%H1653><s%> is over <S%H2498><s%> and gone. <S%H1980><s%>

The flowers <S%H5339><s%> appear <S%H7200><s%> on the earth. <S%H776><s%> The time <S%H6256><s%> of the singing <S%H2158><s%> has come, <S%H5060><s%> and the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the turtledove <S%H8449><s%> is heard <S%H8085><s%> in our land. <S%H776><s%>

The fig tree <S%H8384><s%> ripens <S%H2590><s%> her green figs. <S%H6291><s%> The vines <S%H1612><s%> are in blossom. <S%H5563><s%> They give <S%H5414><s%> forth their fragrance. <S%H7381><s%> Arise, <S%H6965><s%> my love, <S%H7474><s%> my beautiful one, <S%H3303><s%> and come away. <S%H3212><s%>" Lover

My dove <S%H3123><s%> in the clefts <S%H2288><s%> of the rock, <S%H5553><s%> In the hiding <S%H5643><s%> places <S%H4095><s%> of the mountainside, <S%H7200><s%> Let me see your face. <S%H4758><s%> Let me hear <S%H8085><s%> your voice; <S%H6963><s%> for your voice <S%H6963><s%> is sweet, <S%H6156><s%> and your face <S%H4758><s%> is lovely. <S%H5000><s%>

Catch <S%H270><s%> for us the foxes, <S%H7776><s%> the little <S%H6996><s%> foxes <S%H7776><s%> that spoil <S%H2254><s%> the vineyards; <S%H3754><s%> for our vineyards <S%H3754><s%> are in blossom. <S%H5563><s%> Beloved
My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is mine, <S%H7462><s%> and I am his. He browses among the lilies. <S%H7799><s%>

Until the day <S%H3117><s%> is cool, <S%H6315><s%> and the shadows <S%H6752><s%> flee away, <S%H5127><s%> turn, <S%H5437><s%> my beloved, <S%H1730><s%> and be like <S%H1819><s%> a roe <S%H6643><s%> or a young <S%H6082><s%> hart <S%H354><s%> on the mountains <S%H2022><s%> of Bether. <S%H1336><s%>
